title: Slope-Intercept Form
text:
Write the first equation in slope-intercept form:
$$4x+2y=10$$
$$2y=-4x+10$$
$$ rac{2y}{2}= rac{\left(-4x+10ight)}{2}$$
$$y=-2x+5$$
speech:
Write the first equation in slope-intercept form:
 4 x plus 2 y is equal to, 10 
 2 y, is equal to negative 4 x, plus 10 
, fraction, 2 y, over 2,  is equal to fraction, parentheses, negative 4 x, plus 10 , over 2,  
 y is equal to, negative 2 x, plus 5

, fraction, 2 y, over 2,  is equal to fraction, , negative 4 x, plus 10 , over 2,
y is equal to, negative 2 x, plus 5

title: Slope-Intercept Form
text:
Write the second equation in slope-intercept form:
$$4x-2y=-6$$
$$-2y=-4x-6$$
$$ rac{-2y}{-2}= rac{\left(-4x-6ight)}{-2}$$
$$y=2x+3$$
speech:
Write the second equation in slope-intercept form:
 4 x minus 2 y is equal to, negative 6 
 negative 2 y is equal to negative 4 x, minus 6 
 fraction, negative 2 y, over, negative 2,  is equal to fraction, parentheses, negative 4 x, minus 6 , over, negative 2,  
 y is equal to, 2 x plus 3

title: Intersecting Lines
text: Since the slopes are different, the lines intersect.
